t: Psalm 88
I Cry Out Day and Night Before You
A Song. A Psalm of the Sons of Korah. To the choirmaster: according to Mahalath Leannoth. A Maskil of Heman the Ezrahite.
O*pn Lord,*s God of my salvation, I*ld cry out day and night before you.
Let*ln my prayer come before you; incline*ld your ear to my cry!
For*pn my soul is full of troubles, and*ld my life draws near to Sheol.
I*ln am counted among those who go down to the pit; I*ld am a man who has no strength,
like*ln one set loose among the dead, like*ld the slain that lie in the grave, like*ln those whom you remember no more, for*ld they are cut off from your hand.
You*ln have put me in the depths of the pit, in*ld the regions dark and deep.
Your*ln wrath lies heavy upon me, and*ld you overwhelm me with all your waves. Selah*ig
You*pn have caused my companions to shun me; you*ld have made me a horror to them. I*ln am shut in so that I cannot escape;
my*ld eye grows dim through sorrow. Every*ln day I call upon you, O Lord;*s I*ld spread out my hands to you.
Do*ln you work wonders for the dead? Do*ld the departed rise up to praise you? Selah*ig
Is*ln your steadfast love declared in the grave, or*ld your faithfulness in Abaddon?
Are*ln your wonders known in the darkness, or*ld your righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
But*pn I, O Lord,*s cry to you; in*ld the morning my prayer comes before you.
O*ln Lord,*s why do you cast my soul away? Why*ld do you hide your face from me?
Afflicted*ln and close to death from my youth up, I*ld suffer your terrors; I am helpless.
Your*ln wrath has swept over me; your*ld dreadful assaults destroy me.
They*ln surround me like a flood all day long; they*ld close in on me together.
You*ln have caused my beloved and my friend to shun me; my*ld companions have become darkness.
